item.title: Chimera's Prism
item.description: Mercury’s Shadow is Book Two of the Kardashev Cycle released in 2021. Visit pjgarcin.com for more info.

item.title: Mercury's Shadow
item.description: Mercury’s Shadow is Book One of the Kardashev Cycle, my sci-fi series released in 2020. Visit pjgarcin.com for more info.

item.title: Sol's Dawn
item.description: Sol’s Dawn is a collection of origin stories in the Kardashev Cycle. You can get it for free on pjgarcin.com.

item.title: Mark McMorris Infinite Air
item.description: Snowboard Simulation title on PS4, XB1, PC released in 2016.

item.title: Building Game AI using Machine Learning: Working with TensorFlow, Keras and Intel MKL in Python
item.description: A look into how I built NeuroBlast in Python taking advantage of Intel MKL optimizations and many of the open-source data-science packages available.

item.title: Building an ML-Powered game AI using TensorFlow in Go
item.description: Guest Blog on GopherData.io covering building NeuroBlast for Go.

item.title: GopherCon 17 Lightning Talk: Building ML-Powered Game AI using TensorFlow in Go
item.description: A 10-minute talk I gave at GopherCon 2017 on building NeuroBlast in Go.

item.title: NeuroBlast: Classic space shooter powered by ML
item.description: NeuroBlast is a classic arcade space shooter powered by ML.

item.title: Surveying the Go Database Landscape
item.description: A survey of the Go database landscape.

item.title: Using Pre-Trained Models with TensorFlow in Go
item.description: Using pre-trained COCO object identification in Go.

item.title: Go Man's Sky
item.description: ANSi space exploration game created for Ludum Dare 38 over a weekend.

item.title: go-ansi
item.description: go-ansi is a CLI and library that takes ANSi BBS art files and converts them to PNG/bitmaps. I used this to drive the art in Go Man’s Sky.
